text: Charles Georg Lachs (1879-1972) was a Bavarian-Swedish visual artist. Specialising in oil and etching, his motifs ranged from landscapes and portraits to humble working class areas around fin de siècle Stockholm. == Biography == Charles Lachs was born in 1879 in Örebro to Friedrichs Lachs, and Fredrika (née Lorentzon). He was the brother of Charlotte Lachs, singer, and Alice Brauner. He married Ellen Lindelöw from Ångermanland. Lachs studied at Tekniska skolan (future Konstfack) 1894-1897, and at Konstnärsförbundets målarskola 1900. In addition, he was tutored at the etching school of Axel Tallberg, and made study travels around the United States, and the German Empire. He shared atelier with artists such as Ivar Arosenius, and John Bauer. Lachs is represented inter alia at the National Library of Sweden, and Stockholm City Museum.https://arken.kb.se/SE-S-HS-ACC1993-231 == References == * Södermalm med omnejd i bilder av Charles Lachs (Stockholmia förlag, 2009, ) by Alice Rasmussenhttp://www.mynewsdesk.com/se/pressreleases/soedermalm-med- omnejd-i-bilder-av-charles- lachs-275105https://www.kungahuset.se/monarkinhovstaterna/kungligastiftelser/kultur/konunggustafviadolfsfondforsvenskkultur/utdelningar/utdelningar/utdelning2007.4.292a62ce13848168ac537ef.html *Svenskt konstnärslexikon III, p. 440 (Allhems Förlag, Malmö) *Svenska konstnärer: biografisk handbok, p. 285 (Väbo förlag, 1987) Category:1879 births Category:1972 deaths Category:Swedish male painters Category:Swedish etchers Category:19th-century Swedish painters Category:19th-century male artists Category:20th-century Swedish painters Category:20th-century male artists Category:Swedish portrait painters Category:Swedish landscape painters Category:German male painters Category:German etchers Category:19th-century German painters Category:20th-century German painters Category:German portrait painters Category:German landscape painters
